label: Dynamic Route Planning & Optimization
description: AI-driven real-time route optimization considering traffic, weather, delivery windows, and vehicle constraints for cost and service level optimization.

traditional.workflow: Static route planning performed daily or weekly using basic routing software with limited real-time adjustment capability. Dispatchers manually assign orders to trucks based on geography and experience. Limited consideration of traffic patterns, weather, or delivery time windows. Routes locked once trucks depart with minimal dynamic re-routing. Manual exception handling for service failures or delays.
constraints: 10-20% route inefficiency (empty miles, suboptimal sequencing)
30-45 minute average route planning time per truck
Limited real-time visibility into truck locations/status
5-10% on-time delivery miss rate
Manual communication with drivers (phone calls, texts)

agentic.workflow: AI routing engine continuously optimizes routes based on real-time order additions, traffic conditions, weather forecasts, delivery time windows, vehicle capacities, and driver hours-of-service regulations. Machine learning predicts delivery time with high accuracy using historical patterns and current conditions. System dynamically re-routes trucks mid-journey to accommodate new rush orders or avoid traffic incidents. Automated communication to drivers via mobile apps with turn-by-turn navigation and delivery instructions. Predictive ETA updates automatically sent to customers. Continuous learning from actual vs. planned performance.
dataSources: Real-time order queue with delivery windows
benefits: 15-25% reduction in total miles driven
20-35% improvement in on-time delivery (98%+ vs 90-95%)
85-95% faster route planning (2-5 min vs 30-45 min per truck)
10-15% fuel cost savings
30-40% increase in daily delivery capacity per truck

quickWins: Deploy AI route optimization for core delivery zones (15% mile reduction)
Enable real-time traffic integration (10% faster deliveries)
Implement automated customer ETA notifications

label: Intelligent Carrier Selection & Rate Shopping
description: Automated carrier selection optimizing for cost, service level, and sustainability using real-time rate shopping and performance analytics.

traditional.workflow: Manual carrier selection based on negotiated contract rates and default routing guides. Limited rate shopping across carriers due to time constraints. Static carrier assignments without performance-based optimization. Quarterly carrier scorecarding with slow adjustments to routing guides. Manual entry of shipment details for rating and booking.
constraints: 80-90% shipments go to default carrier (limited optimization)
Quarterly carrier performance reviews (slow to adapt)
15-25% overpayment vs optimal carrier/service selection
No real-time rate comparison
Limited visibility into carrier capacity constraints

agentic.workflow: AI carrier selection engine evaluates every shipment against all available carriers and service levels in real-time, considering contracted rates, spot market rates, delivery requirements, carrier performance history, and sustainability goals. Machine learning optimizes for total landed cost including freight, damage rates, and on-time performance. System automatically books shipments with selected carrier via API integration. Continuous carrier performance monitoring with dynamic routing guide adjustments. Predictive analytics identify carrier capacity constraints and recommend proactive contract negotiations.
dataSources: Contracted carrier rates and routing guides
benefits: 10-20% reduction in transportation costs through optimal selection
30-45% increase in carrier diversity (4-6 carriers utilized regularly)
95-99% carrier selection accuracy vs optimal
50-70% reduction in freight audit discrepancies
15-25% carbon emission reduction through mode/carrier optimization
metrics: Carrier diversity: 4-6 carriers optimized by lane
Carrier scorecard frequency: Real-time with weekly reviews

quickWins: Enable automated rate shopping for parcel shipments (8-12% cost savings)
Deploy carrier performance scorecards with monthly reviews
Implement API-based carrier booking (60% time savings)
prerequisites: Carrier contract rate data in structured format
Shipment history with carrier performance data

label: Automated Freight Audit & Payment
description: AI-powered invoice auditing with automated dispute resolution and payment processing to eliminate overcharges and streamline AP workflows.

traditional.workflow: Manual matching of carrier invoices to shipment records and contracted rates. AP staff manually review 3-way match (PO, shipment, invoice) for discrepancies. Accessorial charges often not validated. Disputes handled via email/phone with carriers over weeks or months. Payment cycles delayed by audit backlogs. Lost savings from untimely dispute filing.
constraints: 5-15% of freight invoices have errors (overcharges, incorrect rates, duplicate charges)
3-7 days invoice audit cycle time
Manual review capacity: 50-100 invoices per day per analyst
30-50% of disputed charges recovered (rest expire or not pursued)
15-30 day payment cycles

agentic.workflow: AI freight audit system automatically ingests carrier invoices (EDI, email, portal) and matches to shipment records and contracted rates. Machine learning validates accessorial charges against actual service delivery using telematics and proof-of-delivery data. System auto-approves clean invoices for payment and flags discrepancies with AI-generated dispute documentation. Automated dispute submission to carriers via EDI with tracking. Continuous analysis identifies systemic billing issues and carrier performance trends. Dynamic payment terms optimization based on cash flow and early payment discount opportunities.
benefits: 98-100% invoice audit coverage (vs 60-80%)
90-95% reduction in audit cycle time (hours vs 3-7 days)
80-90% dispute recovery rate (vs 30-50%)
2-5% total freight spend savings from recovered overcharges
70-85% reduction in AP processing costs

quickWins: Deploy automated rate validation for top 3 carriers (1-2% spend savings)
Enable OCR invoice ingestion (50% data entry time reduction)
Implement automated dispute documentation generation
prerequisites: TMS with shipment and rate data
Carrier EDI connectivity or invoice digitization capability

label: Intelligent Load Consolidation & Planning
description: AI-driven load building and consolidation to maximize vehicle utilization, reduce shipments, and lower transportation costs.

traditional.workflow: Manual load planning based on fixed shipping schedules and basic cube/weight calculations. Orders shipped as they become available without holding for consolidation opportunities. Limited cross-warehouse load consolidation. Simple first-in-first-out (FIFO) shipment logic without optimization. Significant partial truck shipments and underutilized trailer space.
constraints: 30-50% average truck capacity utilization (cube and weight)
Limited hold time for consolidation (same-day ship pressure)
No optimization across multiple DCs or warehouses
Manual tetris-style load planning (2-4 hours per truck)
Frequent LTL shipments that could be consolidated to FTL

agentic.workflow: AI load optimization engine continuously analyzes order pipeline across all warehouses and identifies consolidation opportunities balancing cost savings vs. delivery time commitments. Machine learning algorithms perform 3D bin packing to maximize cube utilization while respecting weight limits and shipment compatibility (fragile, hazmat, temperature). System dynamically determines optimal hold times for orders to achieve consolidation without SLA violations. Cross-warehouse load planning identifies opportunities to combine shipments going to same destination region. Automated load building instructions sent to warehouse including optimal item sequencing for efficient unloading.
dataSources: SKU dimensions, weights, and handling requirements
benefits: 50-80% improvement in truck cube utilization (60-80% vs 30-50%)
30-45% reduction in number of shipments through consolidation
20-35% transportation cost savings
40-60% reduction in LTL shipments (converted to FTL)
90-95% reduction in load planning time (automated)
metrics: Load planning time: 10-20 min/truck (automated with review)

quickWins: Implement automated cube/weight validation (eliminate overweight/overfull trucks)
Enable 2-4 hour hold window for same-destination consolidation (15% shipment reduction)
Deploy 3D load visualization for manual planning support
prerequisites: Delivery commitment data for hold time optimization

label: Real-Time Shipment Tracking & Visibility
description: Unified multi-carrier tracking with predictive ETAs, proactive exception management, and automated customer notifications.

traditional.workflow: Fragmented tracking across multiple carrier portals requiring manual login and tracking number entry. Static ETAs based on carrier's initial estimate without updates. Reactive exception handling after customer complaints or missed delivery appointments. Manual email or call notifications to customers about shipment status. Limited visibility into in-transit inventory.
constraints: Tracking visibility limited to carrier scan events (not real-time GPS)
No predictive ETA updates
Customer service reps spend 30-40% time tracking shipments manually
48-72 hour delay in identifying delivery exceptions
Inconsistent customer communication (60-70% receive proactive updates)

agentic.workflow: Unified visibility platform aggregates tracking data from all carriers (EDI, API, GPS telematics) into single real-time dashboard. Machine learning continuously refines ETA predictions using actual shipment progress, traffic conditions, weather, and carrier performance patterns. AI exception management automatically detects delivery risks (delayed in transit, weather disruptions, missed pickup) and proactively triggers corrective actions (expedited shipping, customer notifications, appointment rescheduling). Automated personalized notifications to customers via SMS/email with accurate ETAs and delivery day updates. Control tower analytics provide strategic visibility into network performance, transit times, and carrier SLAs.
dataSources: Historical carrier performance (transit times by lane)
benefits: 95-100% real-time shipment visibility across all carriers
90-95% ETA accuracy (vs 70-80%)
60-75% reduction in 'where is my order' customer inquiries
70-85% faster exception resolution (8-12 hours vs 48-72 hours)
95-100% proactive customer notification coverage

quickWins: Deploy unified tracking dashboard for top 3 carriers (80% visibility improvement)
Enable automated shipment status emails to customers (60% inquiry reduction)
Implement exception alerts for delayed shipments
prerequisites: TMS or visibility platform with carrier API integrations
Carrier EDI connectivity or API access

label: Yard & Dock Appointment Scheduling
description: Automated dock scheduling with yard management optimization to reduce dwell time, eliminate detention charges, and improve throughput.

traditional.workflow: Manual dock scheduling via phone or email with limited visibility into warehouse capacity and labor availability. First-come-first-served dock assignment causing congestion during peak periods. No real-time visibility into trailers in yard (location, contents, dwell time). Manual yard checks to locate specific trailers. High detention and demurrage charges from extended trailer dwell times. Missed delivery appointments due to dock capacity constraints.
constraints: 60-90 minute average truck wait time for dock
3-5 hour average trailer dwell time in yard
15-25% detention charge incidence rate
Manual yard inventory (clipboard or outdated spreadsheet)
10-20% of appointments missed due to dock/labor constraints

agentic.workflow: AI-powered dock scheduling system provides carrier self-service portal for appointment booking with real-time visibility into available slots based on warehouse capacity, labor availability, and shipment priorities. Machine learning optimizes dock assignment balancing receiving vs. shipping needs and load characteristics (pallet count, appointment duration estimate). RFID or computer vision automatically tracks trailer locations in yard and updates yard management system. Predictive analytics forecast dock capacity needs and trigger proactive labor scheduling. Automated alerts to carriers when approaching detention thresholds with dock readiness updates. Dynamic appointment rescheduling to accommodate urgent shipments.
dataSources: Historical unload/load time by shipment type
benefits: 70-85% reduction in truck wait time (10-20 min vs 60-90 min)
60-75% reduction in trailer dwell time (1-1.5 hours vs 3-5 hours)
80-90% reduction in detention charges (2-4% vs 15-25%)
25-35% improvement in dock utilization (85-95% vs 60-75%)
95-100% appointment adherence

quickWins: Deploy carrier self-service appointment portal (50% scheduling time reduction)
Implement RFID yard tracking for high-volume lanes (100% trailer location accuracy)
Enable automated detention warning alerts (60% charge reduction)
prerequisites: Yard management system or TMS module
RFID infrastructure or computer vision cameras
Integration with WMS for capacity visibility

label: Transportation Network Design & Optimization
description: Strategic network modeling and continuous optimization of distribution center locations, transportation lanes, and inventory positioning.

traditional.workflow: Annual or biennial strategic network reviews using spreadsheet models or consulting engagements. Static network design based on historical demand patterns without continuous optimization. Limited scenario analysis due to manual modeling constraints. Slow to adapt to demand shifts, new markets, or cost changes. Network decisions driven by real estate availability rather than optimized fulfillment strategy.
constraints: Network reviews: Annual or less frequent
Scenario analysis: 3-5 scenarios (limited by manual effort)
Modeling time: 4-8 weeks per network study
No continuous optimization between formal reviews
Limited consideration of inventory positioning tradeoffs

agentic.workflow: AI-powered network optimization continuously monitors demand patterns, transportation costs, real estate markets, and service level performance to identify network improvement opportunities. Digital twin modeling enables rapid scenario analysis (100+ scenarios) considering DC locations, transportation modes, inventory positioning, and customer service impacts. Machine learning predicts demand shifts by geography and recommends proactive network adjustments (new DC, lane changes, inventory redistribution). Automated what-if analysis for proposed changes (new market entry, DC closure, SKU rationalization). Sustainability modeling includes carbon footprint analysis for network decisions. Continuous validation of network performance vs. plan with auto-generated improvement recommendations.
dataSources: Historical and forecasted demand by geography
Transportation costs by mode and lane
Real estate market data and availability
benefits: Continuous network optimization (quarterly scenario reviews vs annual)
10-20% reduction in total landed cost (transportation + inventory + warehousing)
95%+ scenario analysis capability (100+ scenarios vs 3-5)
80-90% faster decision making (days vs 4-8 weeks)
15-25% reduction in carbon footprint through mode and lane optimization
metrics: Optimization frequency: Continuous with quarterly formal reviews
Time to decision: Days to 1-2 weeks

quickWins: Build digital twin model of existing network for rapid scenario analysis
Implement quarterly automated network performance reviews
Enable self-service what-if scenario modeling for leadership
prerequisites: Historical demand data by customer geography
Transportation cost data by lane and mode
